header_summary:
The blockchain community is currently focused on the development of innovative tools for reconstructing historical mempool data, with a noteworthy project being the mempool replayer developed by @willcl-ark. This tool is designed to allow users to accurately recreate past mempool states at specific timestamps or block heights, offering insights into the dynamics of past transactions. This initiative highlights a growing interest in refining empirical blockchain analysis through more detailed categorization and the proposed addition of a "fee estimation" tag aims to improve the organization and accessibility of information vital for predicting transaction fees.

A detailed study has analyzed fee estimation data across 435 blocks, revealing significant insights into the Bitcoind Policy Estimator's performance in its `conservative` and `economical` modes. Conducted over a span of blocks from 846887 to 847322, this analysis employed a rigorous methodology to log and trace fee estimates, resulting in the identification of a marked difference in the overestimation tendencies between the two modes. The `conservative` mode consistently overestimated fees, particularly evident in Block 847088, while the `economical` mode displayed a superior ability to adapt to fee market changes, suggesting its efficiency and responsiveness. These findings, along with the datasets, are made available for further exploration through the [Data repository](https://gist.github.com/ismaelsadeeq/6a6531e9b96bfeed20178e353b187332) and the [Fee Estimates Analysis repository](https://github.com/ismaelsadeeq/fee-estimates-analysis/tree/analyse-bitcoind-estimates).

JoinMarket with Jam introduces a novel approach to conducting transactions that enhances privacy and security by eliminating the need for a central coordinator. Despite the complexity of its setup compared to traditional wallets, it promises a more decentralized transaction experience. Yet, the absence of detailed technical information on its decentralization methodologies, as highlighted in the [JamDocs](https://jamdocs.org/philosophy/03-joinmarket/) documentation, suggests a need for further clarification on how it achieves its decentralized coordination, indicating an area ripe for additional research and discussion.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoind Policy Estimator modes Analysis
recent_posts.summary:

- `Conservative` mode tends to overestimate fees more than the `economical` mode.
- Recommends the `economical` mode for aligning with real-time fee market conditions.

- The initiative aims to enhance privacy and security in cryptocurrency transactions.

active_posts.title: Second Look at Weak Blocks
active_posts.summary:
- This proposal aims to improve compact block relay efficiency by introducing weak blocks.
- A Proof of Concept has shown potential, but further discussion on technical parameters is needed.
- Future steps involve gathering developer and miner feedback to assess practical implementation and adoption.

active_posts.title: Human Readable Bitcoin Payment Instructions
active_posts.summary:
- A draft Bitcoin Improvement Proposal introduces human-readable names for Bitcoin payments using DNSSEC.
- The proposal, available on GitHub, aims to standardize Bitcoin URIs without altering existing payment methods.
- It focuses on enhancing user experience by simplifying transactions with static invoice formats.

today_in_history_posts.title: MAD-HTLC
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A report claims HTLC's security depends on altruistic or short-sighted miners.
- Making bitcoind non-myopic required 150 lines of code, raising sustainability doubts.
- An alternative, MAD-HTLC, is introduced, being secure as it aligns with everyone's interests.

today_in_history_posts.title: Disclosure of a fee blackmail attack that can make a victim loose almost all funds of a non Wumbo channel and potential fixes
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A potential blackmail attack on the Lightning Network was discovered in July 2019, exploiting HTLCs.
- Solutions include lowering HTLC limits and a patch by C-lightning, while lnd lacks a hard cap.
- Suggestions for mitigation involve adjusting fees and HTLC values, and improving vulnerability disclosure.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's scalability involves creating 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for mass transactions.
- These off-chain solutions, essential for Bitcoin's growth, balance affordability with security but differ greatly in design and trust levels.
- Future focus includes enhancing second-layer solution security and Layer 1 exit strategies, maintaining Bitcoin's integrity.
